item.title: [DISTRELEC-4816] Wrong unit in technical view
item.description:
In the technical view, wrong units are displayed.

E.g. pitch is indicated as 0.002 mm while in the facet it's indicated correctly with 2 mm, as according to the data in PIM.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Remo: Kannst du dir das mal anschauen?

We use the WebUse-Field from Factfinder to display the technical attributes.

Despite exporting it with the units in hybris, the search result contains the normalized values.
I think Adi mentioned some customized logic directly in Factfinder to normalize the units.

I don't know the logic there, but it seems this will only be done on the webuse field and not for the facets.

FF-Export for product 16700249 (Q):

"16700249";"|Kapazität~~µF=10|Nennspannung~~VDC=16|Kapazitätstoleranz=±20%|Rastermass~~mm=1.5|Temperaturbereich~~°C=-40...+85|Durchmesser Gehäuse~~mm=4|Länge~~mm=7|";

FF-SearchResult for product 16700249 (Q):

<entry xmlns="http://ws69.webservice.adapters.factfinder.de">
   <key>WebUse</key>
   <value>
      |Kapazität~~F=0.00001|Nennspannung~~VDC=16|Kapazitätstoleranz=±20%|Rastermass~~m=0.0015|Temperaturbereich~~°C=-40...+85|Durchmesser Gehäuse~~m=0.004|Länge~~m=0.007|
   </value>
</entry>

The issue as you have already mentioned is that the webUse attribute gets normalized in the data record during the import of FF. So we can not use this attribute for the technical attributes. I try now the following:
I'll add a new field in the configuration of FF and configured the field to read the same information as the webUse. Than we can use this new field for the technical view, as this new field gets not normalized. But I have to test first if I will be able to read twice the same source field, probably FF is blocking that.

My solution works. I have added a new virtual field called TechnicalAttributes. This field is pointing to the same data field as the field WebUse. Now I can use this new field for the technical view and all the units are correct.
As post installation we have to change all the FF configuration to have this new field. I will now change the configuration for all channels on FF-D and during the deployment for the other environments.

Now on Q.
Please test.
Tested it and it seems to be alright. Could not find anything (apart from some bad data sets - but they are found in PIM).

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4681] FF - Family & filter issue
item.description: Family information is missing for example when searching for 221625. Aswell adding more filter does not work either and produces an error.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Do we have import-problems?

I think that this is a FF issue. In a normal case FF is delivering the first 7 facets fully resolved. All the other facets will be moved to the drop down. But I think the problem here is that this product has 9 facets, as the first 7 are implicitly selected we do not receive any filters and 2 that are left get just moved to the drop down. So actually FF should just in crease the counter for the first 7 if there is really selectable facet. Otherwise it goes on. So in this case here we should not receive any filters, as non of the filters we have an effect. (All of them are implicitly selected)
So I have to check that with Mr. Türk.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4659] Facets: If only one result, facets show wich '0' possible results
item.summary: Facets: If only one result, facets show wich '0' possible results

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The WebUse facets have been fixed. This has been done with a FF config change. We just show facets that have at least 2 possible facet values. So facets that all facet values get selected implicitly will not be shown anymore. This has just one side effect. If you have a result with 6 products and 1 of that product has a value for a facet but the other ones not, than the facet gets not displayed anymore. But this is just happen if we have bad data quality.
Have you also done this change on the Q FactFinder?

Problem does not seem to be solved.

Both on the Q and the P systems I was able to compose facet selections that returned values with 0 results. See screenshot and the following examples:

http://www.distrelec.ch/search?q=led&filter_Manufacturer=Advanced+Thermal+Solutions&filter_Manufacturer=Apem&filter_InStock=1&filter_Light+colour=blue&filter_LED+diameter~~mm=3&filter_Luminous+intensity+typically=65+mcd

http://test.distrelec.ch/search?q=usb&filter_Category3=USB+memory+%2F+Memory+cards+%2F+Disks+%2F+Tapes&filter_Manufacturer=Disk2go&filter_Capacity~~GB=8&filter_Read~~MB%2Fs=10&filter_Read~~MB%2Fs=8&filter_Write~~MB%2Fs=3

Does this FF config need some kind of deployment?

@Nando: Correct, but this just happen if you have selected before the facet and because continuing filtering you filter the result that much, that the before selected facet is implicitly selected or in other words, the selection has no effect any more.
I think we can fix, but the question is how:
Variant 1: The facet stays and just instead of the 0 we display the count of the found products
Variant 2: The facet disappears, but this probably confuses the customer because a before select facet is not visible any more?
Done?
No, see my last comment. We have to decise which variant we should take. What do you think?

Decision (FBU, RHU):
Variant 1

Please estimate the effort.
Thx
Please clarify with FF.
Decision: We override the record count with the total record count if the record count of facet is 0.
Please test.
works fine on the test system.

Hi Jan

Hi Florian,

Depending on what the outcome should be, the estimation will be quite different.

Solution 1
The easier approach would be to just change the fixed width's to percentage width's. In that case, the problem is, that we cannot really guarantee, that in every zoom level, the layout will look pixel perfect. That is because we have our grid for the overall page and currently fixed width's inside of the cart items..switching to percentage width's will prevent from falling to the next line, but as a downside, will not allways be perfectly aligned with the borders. And because the distrelec design is a lot based on those border lines, I don't know if it is a good direction to go. This "percentage solution" would need quite a lot of trial and error and browser testing.
I Estimate 0.5-1 day

Solution 2
As a more time consuming solution, we would need to switch the whole cart page layout to either a custom grid with no gutters between the columns or a table layout, where again, the last decision about the column width is at the browser. But at least no columns would fall to the next line.
I estimate 1-2 days for this solution

Hi Jan,
Please go for solution 2.
I think we have to live with some layout issues when we are using different browsers. But it is more important to see all basket details.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4775] Family view test results
item.description:
Input from tester:
Als erstes habe ich einige nicht funktionierende Family Views gefunden, z.B. hier: http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Werkzeuge-%26-Messtechnik/Werkzeuge/Handwerkzeuge/Werkzeugaufbewahrung/Werkzeugtaschen-und--koffer-Plano/Werkzeugtaschen/c/cat-169265

Klickt man auf die verschiedenen Produkte (btw alle allein in den Familien im PIM, so erhält man entweder eine 404-Page oder eine „Familienansicht“ mit verschiedenen Herstellern/Produkten gemischt. Ich habe hierzu die Theorie, dass es nicht funktioniert, da verschiedene Produktfamilien denselben Namen haben (z.B. 3x Rollen-Werkzeugkoffer). Raphael hat mir mal gesagt, dass er einen Lookup mit den Namen macht, um die Produktfamilie zu definieren. Wenn die jetzt alle gleich heissen, wird das vermutlich nicht funktionieren. Dies nur so als Idee.

Ausserdem gibt es einige 404-Fehler, wenn man auf den Link klickt, wie etwa hier:
http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Netzteile-%26-Licht/Transformatoren/Leiterplattentransformatoren/Leiterplattentransformatoren%2C-nicht-kurzschlussfest/c/it.productFamilyUrl
http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/Sicherheit-%C3%9Cberwachung/c/it.productFamilyUrl

Letzteres kommt von hier: http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Computer-%26-Hobby/Freizeit-und-Hobby/Sicherheit-%C3%9Cberwachung/c/cat-L3D_542673?q=*&filter_Buyable=1 (die untersten Produkte, Starter kit dLAN). Interessant ist, dass man nach einer 404 keine weiteren Produkte mehr nachladen kann, bis man die Seite nicht neu lädt.

Was mir ebenfalls aufgefallen ist: Klicke ich auf die Familienansicht aus einer höheren Suchebene und lösche ich danach den Filter der Family wieder, lande ich nicht an dem Ort, wo ich angefangen habe (also in der höheren Suchebene), sondern auf der nächsthöheren Kategorie-Ebene (siehe Screenshots). Das finde ich etwas unglücklich, da dies den Kunden verwirrt und nicht dem erwarteten Verhalten einer Website entspricht. Kann man das noch irgendwie anpassen?

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Behauptung 1 stimmt nicht! der Link http://test.distrelec.ch/de/Werkzeuge-%26-Messtechnik/Werkzeuge/Handwerkzeuge/Werkzeugaufbewahrung/Werkzeugtaschen-und--koffer-Plano/Werkzeugtaschen/c/cat-169265 funktioniert tadellos.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4504] Change Source for Suggest
item.description:
The data source for the Category suggest needs to be changed from "Category Path" to the category fields, so that they are identical with the search. Mr. Türk said this was no big deal and that he does not see any reason why we take different sources for the two. However, we should check if there are any dependencies. He has further details, if needed.

Without this structure, campaigns based on category (very, very vital for search optimization with the curren data base) are impossible.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Estimation done.
It is probably not just a FF configuration. The configuration on FF side is no big deal, but I think ii's necessary to shortly discuss this change again with Mr. Türk to be sure that there are no side effects.
Additionally we have to check the handling of the new returned fields, because currently the implementation expects the category path and afterwards the categories gets returned. So I think we have to adapt there the logic, so that the category suggest is still working.

Backend-wise, the suggest seems to work. I again get useful suggestions for setting up campaigns and they work properly when displayed. However, in the suggest layer itself, the links don't work properly, anymore. It seems as if it "jumps" two category levels up (if possible)

Some examples:
If I search for Aluminium-Elektrolytkondensatoren, I end up at the "Passive Bauelemente" Category Page. If I choose "Hammer", I end up in "Handwerkzeuge" instead of the wished category. If I choose "Logitech PC-Joysticks", I end up in "Bildschirme / Mäuse / Tastaturen.

Furthermore, we can add the category level 1 to the suggestions, too, as now all the 2nd level categories are displayed with an empty "in" - which does not look that nice. If we activate the 1st Categories again, only 5 cases will behave like this, which is at least a bit better.
Ist noch nicht deployt! Kommt erst heute auf Q.
Dann kann ich noch lange testen... Ich schau es mir in dem Fall morgen an.
Please test.
